p: The study presented in [ 4] highlighted the antiviral activity of a Morus rotunbiloba infusion against the herpes simplex virus type 2 (HSV2), and they determined a 50% inhibitory concentration of 0.52 Âµg/mL. Methanolic extracts of some Thai medicinal plants have been reported to exhibit anti-HSV1 [ 3] and anti-HSV 2 [ 1] activities by inactivating the viral infections on the plaque-reduction assay.
